article:
{{Infobox rocket  |name = Antares |imsize = 209
|image =Antares rolls out - Oct 2012.jpg |caption = The Antares' first stage
being rolled out on 1 October 2012 for testing in the following months.
|function = Medium expendable launch system |manufacturer = Orbital Sciences |country-
origin = United States |height = |diameter =3.9 m |alt-diameter =12.8 ft |mass = ~240,000 kg  |alt-mass =530,000 lb |stages = 2 to 3  |LEO-payload =  |comparable = Athena
III Delta II |status = Development |sites = Pad 0A, MARS |first=Scheduled for
March 2013 |payloads = Cygnus }} 'Antares', known in early development as
'Taurus II', is an expendable launch system being developed by Orbital Sciences
Corporation. It is designed to launch payloads weighing up to into low-Earth
orbit. It is scheduled to make its first flight in March 2013.

NASA awarded to Orbital a Commercial Orbital Transportation Services (COTS)
contract in 2008 to demonstrate delivery of cargo to the International Space Station. For these COTS missions Orbital intends
to use Antares to launch its Cygnus spacecraft. In addition, Antares will
compete for small-to-medium missions. Aviation Week and Space Technology,
Feb. 25, 2008, p. 22 On Dec. 12, 2011 Orbital Sciences renamed the launch
vehicle "Antares" from the previous designation of Taurus II, after the star of
the same name. [http://www.orbital.com/NewsInfo/release.asp?prid=798]
categories: Orbital Sciences Corporation space launch vehicles
Space launch vehicles of the United States
